channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Triathlon gold goes to Norway at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Great Britain's Alex Yee wins silver in a punishing men's triathlon at the Tokyo Olympics as Kristian Blummenfelt of Norway claims gold.

item.title: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
item.description: The famous Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park are symbols of the Spanish capital's history.

item.title: Flooded London hospitals ask patients to stay away
item.description: Torrential rain saw severe flooding in homes, roads and tube stations in parts of London on Sunday.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: S Korea TV sorry for using pizza to depict Italy
item.description: MBC also used Chernobyl to depict Ukraine and Dracula to show Romania at the Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: Unknown Austrian wins shock cycling gold
item.description: Austria's Anna Kiesenhofer launches a remarkable solo breakaway to win road race gold on her Olympic debut, as Britain's Lizzie Deignan finishes 11th.

item.title: Hugo Millan: Spaniard, 14, dies after crash at MotorLand Aragon
item.description: Hugo Millan, a 14-year-old motorbike rider, has died after crashing at a race in Spain.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: France stun reigning champions USA to end 25-game win streak
item.description: The USA's men's basketball team see their 25-game winning streak at the Olympics ended as they are stunned 83-76 by France in their Tokyo opener.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German women's gymnastics team wears full-body suits
item.description: Germany's gymnasts wear full-body suits in women's qualification at the Olympics as they continue their stand against the sexualisation of their sport.

item.title: Meteor wows Norway after blazing through night sky
item.description: The meteor is believed to have landed in a forest after flashes of light were seen across Norway.

item.title: Soldier statue reignites Spanish row over fascism
item.description: Spain's legionnaires symbolised fascism, but Madrid may soon have a statue honouring them.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: I survived Norway's worst terror attack
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in 2011.

item.title: In pictures: Germany grapples with flood aftermath
item.description: A massive clean-up is under way, but Germany's flood damage won't be fixed for many months.

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.

item.title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
item.description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

item.title: Horse racing: Inside the abattoir slaughtering racehorses
item.description: Campaign group Animal Aid set up covert cameras in one of the few slaughterhouses licensed to kill horses.

item.title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
item.description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.
